intro: Fragaria chiloensis var. ananassa, commonly known as the Chilean strawberry, is a perennial plant native to South America. It is characterized by its trifoliate leaves and produces small, red, edible fruits. The plant thrives in temperate climates and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth. It is closely related to the common strawberry, Fragaria × ananassa, but differs in its wild origin and genetic makeup. Due to its unique traits, it is sometimes cultivated for its flavor and ornamental value.
